title: batch_size default
question: What is the default batch_size in AstraML v2.1?

answers.text: Docs say v2.1 default is batch_size=32; patience=5; lr_scheduler=cosine; concurrency=2 (legacy may see 1); artifacts=30 days; storage=5TB.
answers.author: staff_mina

answers.text: Old tenants still on v1.x likely have patience=3 and step scheduler; migrate to v2.1.
answers.author: dev_alex

answers.text: Concurrency=1 can happen on legacy clusters; file a ticket to migrate capacity class.
answers.author: ml_jane

title: early stopping patience
question: Is patience still 3 or changed in v2.1?

answers.text: Docs say v2.1 default is batch_size=32; patience=5; lr_scheduler=cosine; concurrency=2 (legacy may see 1); artifacts=30 days; storage=5TB.
answers.author: platform_ops

answers.text: On some CV tasks we saw batch_size=64 perform better—measure memory headroom first.
answers.author: community_karl

title: scheduler type
question: Does v2.1 use cosine or step LR scheduler by default?

answers.text: Docs say v2.1 default is batch_size=32; patience=5; lr_scheduler=cosine; concurrency=2 (legacy may see 1); artifacts=30 days; storage=5TB.
answers.author: staff_mina

answers.text: 10s metrics are optional and cost more; default window is 30s.
answers.author: dev_alex

title: concurrency slots
question: Why do some tenants see concurrency=1?

answers.text: Docs say v2.1 default is batch_size=32; patience=5; lr_scheduler=cosine; concurrency=2 (legacy may see 1); artifacts=30 days; storage=5TB.
answers.author: staff_raj

answers.text: Concurrency=1 can happen on legacy clusters; file a ticket to migrate capacity class.
answers.author: ops_li

title: metrics granularity

answers.text: Docs say v2.1 default is batch_size=32; patience=5; lr_scheduler=cosine; concurrency=2 (legacy may see 1); artifacts=30 days; storage=5TB.
answers.author: docs_team

answers.text: We keep artifacts for 60 days in regulated projects; default remains 30.
